result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malik A. Bell

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:32 AM cases 22CF855, 22CF987 called. Attorney Trenton Piltz appears for the State. Defendant Malik A. Bell in court, in custody with Attorney Erika Amundson. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives the pleas and orders 20 days for motions to be filed, can be extended for good cause. Attorney Amundson indicated the defendant wished to request a speedy trial and will file the proper documents. 

Branch 2 for further scheduling.

(Cases 22CF822, 22CF987 are called at 2:43 PM) Defendant Malik A. Bell in court, in custody with Attorney Erika Amundson.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense's motion for bond modification in 22CF987. Defense indicates the Defendant has received an ATR offer involving treatment but would remain on supervision. State objects and makes argument. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Court reviews criminal complaint in 22CF987. 
Court denies motion. 
Arraignment already scheduled in both cases for October 19, 2022 at 9:30 AM.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

records.addlTxt: The Court hereby authorizes the withdrawal of Attorney Richard Yonko, as attorney for the defendant in this case.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order on Motion to Withdraw as Counsel

9:32 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Malik A. Bell in court, in custody with Attorney Richard Louis Yonko. Attorney Yonko states he has a conflict and will need to withdraw as counsel. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver.
Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:22 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Malik A. Bell appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler.
Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 8/15/22 at 2:30 PM.
RTN: 9/7/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
